metadata.title: CVE-2010-3353 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 18.04 LTS (bionic) - low
metadata.description:
Cowbell 0.2.7.1 places a zero-length directory name in the LD_LIBRARY_PATH,which allows local users to gain privileges via a Trojan horse sharedlibrary in the current working directory.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2010-3353` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

cowbell - 0.2.7.1-7
No subscription required

criterions.comment: cowbell package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.2.7.1-7').
